data.question: What is the purpose of using flexible ligands in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: The purpose of using flexible ligands in the synthesis of MOFs is to expand the pore size for MOFs and to realize antenna effect simultaneously.

data.question: What is the chemical formula of the flexible ligand used in the study?
What is the pore size of L1-Eu MOF?
data.answer: The pore size of L1-Eu MOF is approximately 18 Å.

data.question: What is the density of L1-Eu MOF?
data.answer: The density of L1-Eu MOF is 1.2 g/mL.

data.question: What is the limit of detection (LOD) for PO43- using L1-Eu MOF?
data.answer: The limit of detection (LOD) for PO43- using L1-Eu MOF is 0.183 μM.

data.question: What is the limit of detection (LOD) for ATP using L1-Eu MOF?
data.answer: The limit of detection (LOD) for ATP using L1-Eu MOF is 0.147 μM.

data.question: True or False: L1-Eu MOF shows dual-emission under single excitation.
What is the role of the –CH2-O- group in L1-Eu MOF?
data.answer: The –CH2-O- group tunes the energy transfer for dual-emission at 360 and 623 nm from L1-Eu MOF under single excitation of 290 nm.

data.question: True or False: The pore size of MOFs does not affect the response speed and range for target detection.
What is the main advantage of using L1-Eu MOF for the detection of PO43- and ATP?
data.answer: The main advantage of using L1-Eu MOF for the detection of PO43- and ATP is its ability to provide ratiometric sensing and visible detection due to its dual-emission.
